Subsection.Text: The following definitions apply under this chapter:

SubParagraph.Text: An oral or written assertion; or
Nonverbal conduct of a person if it is intended by the person as an assertion.

Paragraph.Text: A “declarant” is a person who makes a statement.
“Hearsay” is a statement, other than one made by the declarant while testifying at the trial or hearing, offered in evidence to prove the truth of the matter asserted.

Subsection.Text: A statement is not hearsay if the declarant testifies at the trial or hearing and is subject to cross-examination concerning the statement and the statement is:

Paragraph.Text: Inconsistent with the declarant’s testimony and was given under oath subject to the penalty of perjury at a trial, hearing, or other proceeding or in a deposition;
Consistent with the declarant’s testimony and is offered to rebut an express or implied charge against the declarant of improper influence, motive, or recent fabrication; or
One of identification of a person made after perceiving the person.
